alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Western Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:38PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Clinton New York, and northern Grand Isle and northwestern Franklin Counties in Vermont through 530 PM EDT... At 437 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jericho, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Beekmantown, Chazy, Franklin, Alburgh Village, Swanton, South Alburgh, Alburgh, Alburgh Dunes State Park, North Hero, Swanton Village, Highgate Falls, Isle La Motte, Lake Carmi State Park, Jericho, Rouses Point, Highgate, Dannemora, Champlain, Berkshire and Sheldon. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 120 and 129. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northern New York...and northwestern Vermont.
